name: Udon Stirfry
keywords: Udon Stirfry, Noodles, Beef, Chicken, Pork, Prawns, Sesame, Chili, Asian, Japanese, Easy, Quick, Stir Fry, Udon Noodles, Noodle Dish, One-Pan, Dinner, Lunch, Healthy, Spicy, Savory, Weeknight Dinner, Family Friendly, Customizable
description: Delicious meaty noodles that are super quick and easy to make. Incredibly versatile and can be modified to your liking.
recipeIngredient: 150g-200g diced protein of choice. (Lean Beef, Chicken Breast, Crispy Pork Belly or Prawns work)
1 baby Bok Choy or Pak Choy

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a pot of water to boil. Add udon noodles and cook them until not quite done.
recipeInstructions.name: Boil noodles

recipeInstructions.text: While noodles cook, add all sauce ingredients to a pan on high heat and start to boil down.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Add the protein of choice to the sauce and start to fry in the sauce. Once noodles are almost cooked, take out of water and add directly to the pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Fry Protein

recipeInstructions.text: Once the protein is almost cooked to your liking, cut the bok choy in chunks, dice the chili and add it to the stir fry. Toss to heat through.
recipeInstructions.name: Add bok choy

recipeInstructions.text: Serve topped with spring onions and sesame seeds.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

notes: I love it with beef, but chicken or prawns also work really well. Already cooked and tender pork belly is the best!
